prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with three holes on its side Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. Face 1 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.128]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.128] to point [0.0, 0.128]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.128] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This face forms the outer boundary of the rectangular prism. Next, we will create the holes in the prism. Loop 2, Circle 1 1. Draw a circle with center at [0.2652, 0.064] and radius of 0.0183. Loop 3, Circle 1 1. Draw a circle with center at [0.375, 0.064] and radius of 0.0183. Loop 4, Circle 1 1. Draw a circle with center at [0.4848, 0.064] and radius of 0.0183. The above loops create the three holes in the rectangular prism. The holes are tangential to the prism surface. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0274 units. Now you have created the first part. The dimensions of this part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.128 units - Height: 0.0274 units Make sure to save the CAD model for Part 1. For the final CAD assembly, you will need to combine Part 1 with the subsequent parts. Refer to the JSON description for each part's boolean operation with the previous body and perform the respective operations to complete the final CAD assembly. Remember, when describing the boolean operation in the instructions for the subsequent parts, avoid using specific boolean operation terms such as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation', 'CutFeatureOperation' etc. Instead, use their natural language descriptions like "create a solid by cutting the current part from the previous part," "create a solid by adding the current part to the previous part," etc.</description>
